name: Lost for Words! 24 Online Trivia | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Everybody's building ships and boats
Some are building monuments, others are jotting down notes
Everybody's in despair, every girl and boy
But when Quinn the ______ gets here
Everybody's gonna jump for joy."

Who is going to bring such pleasure to the event?
questions.explanation:
Eskimo.

	These lyrics come from "Mighty Quinn", written by Bob Dylan.UK pop group Manfred Mann topped the home charts with this song in 1968, peaking a #10 in the US singles chart.

questions.text:
"Cause I live and breathe this ________ freedom
From the day that I was born I've waved the flag
_________ freedom took me knee-high to a man
Yeah gave me peace of mind my daddy never had."

Where is this place that such a freedom exists?
questions.explanation:
Philadelphia.

	"Philadelphia Freedom" was a 1975 hit for flamboyant UK singer Elton John.Elton, real name Reginald Dwight, wrote this song along with Bernie Taupin.A US chart topper, "Philadelphia Freedom" climbed to #12 in the UK.

questions.text:
"But still they begin 
Needles and ______
Because of all my pride 
The tears I gotta hide."

What word is missing from this well-known lyric?
questions.explanation:
pins.

	"Needles And Pins" was written by Jack Nitzsche and Sonny Bono.The Searchers topped the UK charts with this song in 1964, peaking at #13 in the US.

questions.text:
"Winter spring summer or fall 
all you have to do is call 
and I'll be there yeah, yeah, yeah
You've got a ______."

How does this helpful person describe himself?
questions.explanation:
friend.

	These lyrics come from "You've Got A Friend" a 1971 hit for James Taylor. Written by Carole King, the song appeared on her "Tapestry" album.Taylor's version of this smooth ballad was a US chart topper, achieving #4 in the UK.

questions.text:
"I'm feelin' ______ all over
Yes I'm-a ______ all over
Baby I'm ______ all over
So ______ you're mine."

So, what are the Dave Clark Five feeling all over?
questions.explanation:
glad.

	UK group the Dave Clark Five hit with these lyrics from "Glad All Over" in 1964.The song was written by Dave Clark and fellow group member Mike Smith.This UK chart topper climbed to #6 in the US.

questions.text:
"Here she comes now, say, ______, ______
Shoot 'em down, turn around, come on, ______
Hey, she give me love and I feel all right now.
You gotta toss and turn in the middle of the night,
And I feel all right."

Who is coming to give the singer some love?
questions.explanation:
Mony.

	Lyrics from the song "Mony Mony", a 1968 hit for Tommy James and The Shondells.This sixties dance floor-filler was written by Bobby Bloom, Richie Cordell, Bo Gentry and Tommy James.A #3 hit in the US, "Mony Mony" topped the singles chart in the UK.

questions.text:
"All we need is music, sweet music 
There'll be music everywhere 
There'll be swingin', swayin' and ______ playin' 
And dancin' in the streets."

What are they dancing to in the street?
questions.explanation:
records.

	A 1964 dance classic, "Dancing In The Street" was a Motown masterpiece from Martha and The Vandellas.This track had little success in the UK on its original release. When re-issued in 1969 it climbed to #4 in the singles chart."Dancing In The Street" was written by Stevenson, Hunter and Gaye.

questions.text:
"Well I told you once and I told you twice 
But ya never listen to my advice 
You don't try very hard to please me 
With what you know it should be easy 
Well this could be the ______ time 
This could be the ______ time."

Which time is the right time?
questions.explanation:
last.

	These lyrics come from The Rolling Stones 1965 single "The Last Time".Written by Mick Jagger and Keith Richards, this track can be found on the Stones "Big Hits" album.

questions.text:
"Born on a mountain top in Tennessee 
greenest state in the land of the free 
raised in the woods so he knew every tree 
kilt him a bear when he was only three 
______, ______ Crockett, king of the wild frontier!"

What was this famous frontiersman's first name?
questions.explanation:
Davy & Davey.

	This Bill Hayes track goes way back to 1955/6. "The Ballad Of Davy Crockett" sold more than 3 million copies, topping the US charts and peaking at #4 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Then I saw her face, now I'm a ______ 
Not a trace of doubt in my mind
I'm in love, I'm a ______! 
I couldn't leave her if I tried."

What word is missing from this classic 60s track?
questions.explanation:
believer.

	US created for TV group The Monkees charted with these lyrics from the song "I'm a Believer" in 1967.This Neil Diamond composition was a #1 hit in both the US and the UK.
